name: amber
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a hard, transparent, yellowish-brown substance that was formed in ancient times from resin (= a substance produced by trees) and is used in jewellery: He has a collection of prehistoric insects preserved in amber. Greek philosophers discovered that when amber is rubbed against cloth, lightweight objects will stick to it.
humbak/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
a yellow-brown colour: She combines strong geometry with subtle colors, from muted sage to pale amber. Favaios is an amber coloured sweet wine from the Pinhao area of Portugal's Douro Valley.
mainly UK (US usually yellow) the yellowish-orange traffic light that shows between the green and the red to warn drivers that the lights are about to change: The lights turned to amber.
2ndLookGraphics/E+/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesNetsuke are miniature sculptures made of ivory, wood, jade or amber. In about eight years time, the steel will change to a dark amber.The lights flashed amber then green.
